content.text:
# Argalista kingensis

Argalista kingensis is a species of small sea snail with calcareous opercula, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Colloniidae.
Distribution
This marine species is endemic to Australia and occurs in Bass Strait, Tasmania.
References
* May, W. L. (1923). An illustrated index of Tasmanian shells: with 47 plates and 1052 species. Hobart : Government Printer 100 pp.
* May, W. L. (1924). Mollusca of King Island, with descriptions of five new species. Proceedings of the Royal Society of Tasmania. 1923: 47-55.
* Poppe, G.T., Tagaro, S.P. & Huang, S.-I. (2025). The recent Colloniidae, with a study of the Colloniidae collected by various expeditions of the Mus√©um national d'Histoire naturelle, Paris, volume II. Harxheim: ConchBooks. 90 pp.
